TestSuite

Class RunSchwartzset

  • java.lang.Object
    • TestSuite.RunSchwartzset

  • public class RunSchwartzset
extends java.lang.Object
    This Java Class provides functions used to run MapReduce Schwartzset program using Amazon Web Services with generated data.
    The method experiments() contains the code for performing the experiments presented in the AAAI-17 submission "Winner Determination in Huge-Elections with MapReduce".

      Performing the first Experiment for the AAAI17 submission (paperID 2255) You have to specify the following parameters: A local path to store the datasets and logfiles:
      String path= "/home/yourname/somefolder/";

      The name of your s3 bucket, where you are going to store the input and output of the computations:
      String bucketName = "bucketName";

      Amazon EMR writes the logfiles to a specific s3 bucket.

    • Method Detail

      • SchwartzSet

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> SchwartzSet(edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Digraph graph,
                                            java.io.PrintWriter logFile)
        Compute the Schwartzset of the given graph locally. The number of SCCs in the graph and the size of the Schwartzset are written to the logFile. Returns the list of vertices contained in the Schwartzset.
        Parameters:
        graph - Contains a directed graph (DiGraph).
        logFile - PrintWriter object of log File.
        Returns:
        schwartzset List of vertices contained in the schwartzset of graph.

      • writeGraphToFile

        public static void writeGraphToFile(java.io.File file,
                    edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Digraph graph)
        Writes a graph to one single txt-file in the format used as input for the MapReduce algorithms.
        Parameters:
        file - Destination file of the graph.
        graph - The graph that is written to the file.

      • writeGraphToFiles

        public static void writeGraphToFiles(java.lang.String path,
                     edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Digraph graph,
                     java.lang.Integer maxEntries)
        Writes a graph to several files. maxEntries is the maximum number of entries per file and should be a multiple of the number of vertices in the graph. The naming of the files is only configured for up to 999 files.
        Parameters:
        path - Path where the files are written to.
        graph - Input graph.
        maxEntries - maximum number of entries per file.

      • startComputation

        public static com.amazonaws.services.elasticmapreduce.model.AddJobFlowStepsResult startComputation(com.amazonaws.services.elasticmapreduce.AmazonElasticMapReduce emr,
                                                                                   java.lang.String jarlocation,
                                                                                   java.lang.String bucketName,
                                                                                   java.lang.String inputpaths3,
                                                                                   java.lang.String outputpaths3,
                                                                                   java.lang.String clusterID,
                                                                                   java.lang.String N)
        Start a Mapreduce Computation using Amazon Elastic Mapreduce with the jar file located on s3 (jarlocation) and with inputpath and outputpath on the same s3-bucket. The files in the inputpath are ideally created using the provided method writeGraphToFiles().
        Parameters:
        emr - AmazonElasticMapReduce object
        jarlocation - location of the jar file on the s3 bucket with the MapReduce program
        bucketName - name of the s3 bucket
        inputpaths3 - path on the s3 bucket containing the input files
        outputpaths3 - outputpath on the s3 bucket
        clusterID - ID of the used cluster
        N - number of vertices in the input graph
        Returns:
        AddJobFlowStepsResult

      • getStatisticsWithIDs

        public static void getStatisticsWithIDs(java.lang.String clusterlogpath,
                        java.lang.String sourcepath,
                        java.lang.String output,
                        java.lang.Boolean merge)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Reads statistics from the syslog files created by the MapReduce jobs. The clusterlog at clusterlogpath was created by runComputationsOnCluster().
        Parameters:
        clusterlogpath - path of the clusterlog file (created by runComputationsOnCluster())
        sourcepath - local path containing the syslogs (downloaded with getSyslogCluster())
        output - destination file (a csv file)
        merge - if true, than: if there is more than one syslog file the unzipped files are merged using mergefiles()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • generateData

        public static void generateData(java.lang.String path,
                int n,
                int edges,
                int maxEntries,
                java.io.PrintWriter logFile,
                java.lang.Boolean check)
        Generates a random graph and saves it to files. This files are used as input for MapReduce algorithms.
        Parameters:
        path - the graph is saved there
        n - number of vertices
        edges - number of edges
        maxEntries - maximum number of entries per file (a multiple of n)
        logFile - logFile path
        check - true: compute the schwartzset of the graph and write the result to the logFile

      • createDatasets

        public static void createDatasets(com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 s3,
                  java.lang.String path,
                  int[] candidates,
                  double[] fs,
                  int datasets,
                  java.lang.String bucketName)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                  java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Creates random Datasets (graphs) and uploads them to s3. The graphs are created with each given number of vertices (candidates) and edges multiplicator (edges = candidates * fs). For each possible size configuration several datasets are created.
        Parameters:
        s3 - AmazonS3 object
        path - local path to save the datasets
        candidates - array of all possible numbers of vertices
        fs - array of all possible edges-multiplicators (edges=candidates*fs)
        datasets - number of graphs created for each possible size configuration
        bucketName - name of the s3 bucket
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • createDatasets

        public static void createDatasets(com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 s3,
                  java.lang.String path,
                  int[] candidates,
                  double[] fs,
                  int[] datasets,
                  java.lang.String bucketName)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                  java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Creates random Datasets (graphs) and uploads them to s3. The graphs are created with each given number of vertices (candidates) and edges multiplicator (edges = candidates * fs). For each possible size configuration several datasets are created.
        Parameters:
        s3 - AmazonS3 object
        path - local path to save the datasets
        candidates - array of all possible numbers of vertices
        fs - array of all possible edges-multiplicators (edges=candidates*fs)
        datasets - array of indices of graphs that should be created
        bucketName - name of the s3 bucket
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • createDatasets

        public static void createDatasets(com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 s3,
                  java.lang.String path,
                  int[] candidates,
                  double p,
                  int datasets,
                  java.lang.String bucketName)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                  java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Creates random Datasets (graphs) and uploads them to s3. The graphs are created with each given number of vertices (candidates) and density (edges = candidates^2 * p). For each possible size configuration several datasets are created.
        Parameters:
        s3 - AmazonS3 object
        path - local path to save the datasets
        candidates - array of all possible numbers of vertices
        p - edges = candidates^2 * p
        datasets - number of graphs created for each possible size configuration
        bucketName - name of the s3 bucket
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • experiments

        public static void experiments(com.amazonaws.services.elasticmapreduce.AmazonElasticMapReduce emr,
               java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.String bucketName,
               com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 s3,
               java.lang.String jarlocation,
               java.lang.String clusterID,
               java.lang.String logBucketName)
                        throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                               com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Performing the first Experiment for the AAAI17 submission (paperID 2255) You have to specify the following parameters: A local path to store the datasets and logfiles:
        String path= "/home/yourname/somefolder/";

        The name of your s3 bucket, where you are going to store the input and output of the computations:
        String bucketName = "bucketName";

        Amazon EMR writes the logfiles to a specific s3 bucket. The name of the s3 bucket comes here:
        String logBucketName = "logbucketname";

        insert a valid EMR clusterID here:
        String clusterID = "clusterid1234";

        Manually upload the jar file for the mapreduce computation to a s3 bucket. The location of the jarfile is stored in jarlocation:
        String jarlocation = "s3://yourbucket/schwartzset.jar";

        Provide your AWS credentials and start the AmazonS3 client and EMR service:

        AWSCredentials credentials = null;
        credentials = new ProfileCredentialsProvider("yourname").getCredentials();
        AmazonS3 s3 = new AmazonS3Client(credentials);
        AmazonElasticMapReduce emr = new AmazonElasticMapReduceClient(credentials);

        Than the experiments are ready to start:
        experiments( emr, path, bucketName, s3,jarlocation,clusterID,logBucketName);
        Parameters:
        path - local path for storing the datasets
        bucketName - name of the s3 bucket
        s3 - AmazonS3 object
        jarlocation - location of the jar file for the MapReduce Computation
        clusterID -
        logBucketName - name of the bucket where EMR saves the syslogs
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException

      • runComputationsOnCluster

        public static void runComputationsOnCluster(com.amazonaws.services.elasticmapreduce.AmazonElasticMapReduce emr,
                            java.lang.String clusterID,
                            java.lang.String bucketName,
                            java.lang.String jarlocation,
                            int[] candidates,
                            double[] fs,
                            int datasets,
                            java.io.PrintWriter logFile)
                                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Run Computations of existing datasets (on s3). The datasets should be created using one of the createDatasets() functions. Use the same input values of candidates, fs and datasets, as for generating the datasets. The logFile stores the clusterID, stepID and information on the input graph.
        Parameters:
        emr - AmazonElasticMapReduce object
        clusterID - the ID of the cluster
        bucketName - the name of the s3 bucket wher the input data is stored
        jarlocation - location of the jar-file on the s3 bucket
        candidates -
        fs -
        datasets -
        logFile - PrintWriter
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
